forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 4am, then rain showers. Cloudy, with a low around 53. Southwest wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 30 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers before 4pm, then a slight chance of rain between 4pm and 5pm. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West wind 9 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the early hours of this December morning, Downtown San Francisco is shrouded in a gentle veil of rain, punctuated by gusty southwest winds whispering secrets of the Pacific. The streets glisten beneath the soft illumination of streetlights, reflecting the burgeoning moisture. As the clock ticks past one, expect rain showers to persist until the dawn, setting the tone for a day of variable skies. The promise of more rainfall looms, a delicate ballet with a 90% chance of drizzle or showers clinging to the edges of the day. 

As the hours stretch toward afternoon, the clouds may concede to glimpses of sun, although they will retain their mischievous nature, swirling and shifting. As the temperature hovers in the cool upper fifties, there lies an undeniable chill in the air, demanding layers. A comfortable sweater under a waterproof coat and perhaps a sturdy umbrella will be your steadfast companions. The forecast beckons for a day spent savoring the cozy indoors. Curl up with a good book at your favorite café, or take a leisurely stroll through the bustling streets, enjoying the rhythmic dance of raindrops as they serenade the city. In this moment, one might find a certain poetry in the drizzle, making the promise of warmth and shelter all the more inviting.
